author: GamingBolt
description:
Forspoken's poor commercial response has never sat right with us. It was a game that did a great job of bringing its world to life with its excellent visuals, while making your way through that world is a stunning showcase of what current-gen hardware can achieve. 

Its story wasn't too bad either. But a few lines taken out of context, robbed the game of the chance it needed to prove itself, and its developers suffered the consequences as a result. 

Join us as we take a look at one of modern gaming's bittersweet tales, and attempt to give one of this generation's underrated titles its due. We might even convince you to give this one a shot.
title: Forspoken, Three Years Later - Was It Really A BAD Game?

author: GamingBolt
description:
Splinter Cell remains AWOL, and Hitman World of Assassination has you hunting down Slim Shady (not that this is a bad thing). Nevertheless, 2025 is chock-full of new stealth experiences, from follow-ups to familiar franchises to long-missed legends. 

The sheer range and variety this year, with different perspectives, settings, and gameplay mechanics, is pretty incredible. But the question always remains: Which is the best?
title: 10 Most INTENSE Stealth Games of 2025 That Will Keep You On Edge
